trial_identification.studytitle: Efficacy of a micronutrient fortified seasoning powder on micronutrient status, health, and physical and cognitive development of North East Thai primary school children.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Randomized controlled trial of the efficacy of a seasoning powder fortified with iron, zinc, vitamin A, and iodine on biochemical indices, growth and body composition, morbidity, and cognitive function of primary school children from North East Thailand.

conditions.healthcondition: Anemia and deficiencies of iron, zinc, vitamin A, and iodine

interventions.interventions: Intervention: seasoning powder fortified with iron, zinc, vitamin A, and iodine was served with school lunches of instant noodles or rice and consumed on each school day (5 days/week) for 31 weeks.
interventions.comparator: Control: unfortified seasoning powder served with school lunches of instant noodles or rice and consumed on each school day (5 days/week) for 31 weeks.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Anemia defined as: Haemoglobin (Hb) < 115 g/L, males and females, 5 age (years) < 12; Hb < 120 g/L, males and females, age (years) Ã¿Â³ 12.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at baseline and at the end of the 31 week trial.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 1. Apparently healthy primary school children 2. Hemoglobin > 80 g/L 3. Parental approval to participate in all aspects of the study 4. Parental approval to not use vitamin and mineral supplements during the trial.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Children with evidence of recent acute or chronic illnessesChildren with hemoglobin < 80 g/L.

trial_design.concealment: All children were randomized to the intervention or control group at one time. A text file containing the names of the consented children, a school code, their sex, and age, were sent to the project statistician in New Zealand. The statistician had no involvement with the recruitment of the children. A random number was generated for each child using the statistical package STATA. Children within each stratum, defined by school, age (< 108 months, Â³ 108 months) and sex, were sorted by random number. Children in the first half were assigned to receive intervention A, while those in the second half were assigned to intervention B.
trial_design.sequence: The sequence was generated using the uniform() function in the statistical package STATA (StataCorp. 2001. Stata Statistical Software: Release 7.0. College Station, TX: Stata Corporation). Stratification was used, with the strata being school, age (< 108 months, Â³ 108 months), and sex.

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Institute of Nutrition, Mahidol University, Thailand

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Human Ethics Committees of Mahidol University and University of Otago
